content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a risk-averse individual who values security and certainty, I would lean towards the strategy that provides a consistent return over rounds, minimizing potential losses. In this game, the highest consistent return is achieved by choosing B (20$ per round). The possibility of getting 45$ in a single round when both players choose R is tempting, but it's not worth the risk of receiving 0$ 75 times if the other player always chooses R. Choosing B gives me a guaranteed income and minimizes the potential losses, which aligns with my preference for security and certainty in life. I would therefore choose B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, since both me and my opponent chose B in the previous round, we each receive a payoff of 20$ as per the rules of the game. For the next round, I will follow the same strategy of choosing B {B} to maintain consistency and minimize potential losses while maintaining a secure income of 20$ per round. This approach is consistent with my preference for security and certainty in life.
